Source code for havoc.autoval.tests.openbmc_utils_stress.openbmc_utils_stress

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

import re

from havoc.autoval.lib.test_base import TestBase
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval_exceptions import TestError



[docs]class OpenbmcUtilsStress(TestBase):

[docs]    def __init__(self, stress_count):
        self.stress_count = stress_count
        super(OpenbmcUtilsStress, self).__init__()



[docs]    def execute(self):
        self.log_info("This is the OpenBMC Utils Check test")
        stress_count = self.stress_count

        for n in range(1, stress_count + 1):
            self.validate_condition(
                True, "OpenBMC utils stress %d - starting" % n
            )

            self.check_event_log()
            self.check_fw_util()
            self.check_fruid_util()
            self.check_power_util()
            self.check_fan_util()
            self.check_sensor_util()
            self.check_cfg_util()
            self.check_fpc_util()

            self.validate_condition(True, "OpenBMC utils stress %d - done" % n)


    # Check log-util --clear works

[docs]    def check_log_util_clear(self):
        self.log_info("Check log-util --clear")

        # Read the logs before clearing
        self.host.oob.log_message()

        # clear the logs
        self.host.oob.sel_clear()

        # Read the logs and verify if the clear worked.
        out = self.host.oob.log_message()

        count = 0
        for line in out.splitlines():  # noqa: B007 T25377293 Grandfathered in
            count += 1

        self.validate_condition(
            count == 1, "Validate log-util --clear, cleared the log"
        )


    # Check if the event created is reported in logs

[docs]    def check_event_log(self):
        self.log_info("Check log_util --print")

        self.check_log_util_clear()

        # Create an event and check the logs for it
        self.host.oob.generate_test_event()
        out = self.host.oob.log_message()

        pattern_string = [r'\CATERR']
        if not self._pattern_match(out, pattern_string):
            raise TestError("Event Did Not Get Logged")


    # Verify the fw-util

[docs]    def check_fw_util(self):
        self.log_info("Check fw-util")

        pattern_string = [
            r'\CPLD Version:', r'\Bridge-IC Version:',
            r'\Bridge-IC Bootloader Version:', r'\ME Version:',
            r'\PVCCIN VR Version:', r'\DDRAB VR Version:', r'\P1V05 VR Version:',
            r'\PVCCGBE VR Version:', r'\PVCCSCSUS VR Version:', 'BIOS Version:'
        ]

        out = self.host.oob.fw_util()
        if not self._pattern_match(out, pattern_string):
            raise TestError("fw-util did not fetch all the FW info")


    # Verify the fruid-util for slot

[docs]    def check_fruid_util(self):
        self.log_info("Check fruid-util")

        pattern_string = [
            r'\Board Mfg Date\s+:', r'\Board Mfg\s+:', r'\Board Product\s+:',
            r'\Board Serial\s+:', r'\Board Part Number\s+:', r'\Board FRU ID\s+:',
            r'\Board Custom Data 1\s+:', r'\Product Manufacturer\s+:',
            r'\Product Name\s+:', r'\Product Part Number\s+:',
            r'\Product Version\s+:', r'\Product Serial\s+:',
            r'\Product Asset Tag\s+:', r'\Product FRU ID\s+:',
            r'\Product Custom Data 1\s+:', r'\Product Custom Data 2\s+:'
        ]

        # Get the fruid of slot
        out = self.host.oob.fru_list()
        if not self._pattern_match(out, pattern_string):
            raise TestError("fruid-util did not fetch all SLOT info")

        # Get the fruid of nic
        out = self.host.oob.nic_fru_list()
        if not self._pattern_match(out, pattern_string):
            raise TestError("fruid-util did not fetch all NIC info")

        # Get the fruid of spb
        out = self.host.oob.spb_fru_list()
        if not self._pattern_match(out, pattern_string):
            raise TestError("fruid-util did not fetch all SPB info")


    # Verify the power-util for slot

[docs]    def check_power_util(self):
        self.log_info("Check power_util")

        # Check the power status.
        out = self.host.oob.power_status()

        pattern_string = [r':\s+ON']
        if not self._pattern_match(out, pattern_string):
            raise TestError("Power Util: Wrong Power Status")


    # Verify the fan-util

[docs]    def check_fan_util(self):
        self.log_info("Check fan_util")

        # Get the fan speed.
        out = self.host.oob.get_fan_speed()

        pattern_string = [r'\Fan 0 Speed:', 'Fan 1 Speed:']
        if not self._pattern_match(out, pattern_string):
            raise TestError("Fan Util: Wrong Fan Speed info")


    # Verify the sensor-util

[docs]    def check_sensor_util(self):
        self.log_info("Check sensor-util")

        # Get sensor values
        out = self.host.oob.sensor_data()
        out += self.host.oob.nic_sensor_data()
        out += self.host.oob.spb_sensor_data()

        # Check for any NA value
        match = re.search(r"\(na\)", out)
        if match:
            raise TestError("Sensor util: NA in Sensor values")


    # Verify the cfg-util

[docs]    def check_cfg_util(self):
        self.log_info("Check cfg-util")

        # Get the config details.
        out = self.host.oob.get_cfg()

        pattern_string = [
            'identify_sled:', 'slot1_por_cfg:', 'slot2_por_cfg:',
            'slot3_por_cfg:', 'slot4_por_cfg:', 'slot1_sensor_health:',
            'slot2_sensor_health:', 'slot3_sensor_health:',
            'slot4_sensor_health:', 'spb_sensor_health:', 'nic_sensor_health:',
            'slot1_sel_error:', 'slot2_sel_error:', 'slot3_sel_error:',
            'slot4_sel_error:'
        ]

        if not self._pattern_match(out, pattern_string):
            raise TestError("CFG util: Wrong Config info")


    # Verify the fpc-util
    # NOTE: fpc-util is used for identifying SLOT/SLED,
    # so have to check physically to see if the LED is blinking

[docs]    def check_fpc_util(self):
        self.log_info("Check fpc-util")

        # Turn ON slot LED using fpc-util.
        self.host.oob.set_fpc_util("on")

        # Get the config details.
        out = self.host.oob.get_cfg()

        current_slot = self.host.oob.get_slot_info()
        pattern = re.compile('identify_%s:on' % current_slot)
        match = re.search(pattern, out)
        if not match:
            raise TestError("FPC util: Wrong LED status")

        # Turn OFF slot LED using fpc-util.
        self.host.oob.set_fpc_util("off")

        # Get the config details.
        out = self.host.oob.get_cfg()

        pattern = re.compile('identify_%s:off' % current_slot)
        match = re.search(pattern, out)
        if not match:
            raise TestError("FPC util: Wrong LED status")


    def _pattern_match(self, out, pattern_string):

        for x in pattern_string:
            pattern = re.compile(x)
            match = pattern.search(out)
            if not match:
                return False

        return True
